attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the world today life is counting for
less and the penalty for murder is literally a slap on the wrist.
How can we call ourselves civilised when a murderer is treated better than our innocent.
I would like hanging re-introduced, with DNA testing available the likelihood of wrongful sentencing is reduced to almost zero.
Murder has become away of life in some parts of Britain and if hanging was re-introduced people would think twice before committing this final act. The prisons have let out people in the past who have re-offended straight away and other families have suffered grief unnecessarily, hanging for murder would stop this.

rejection.details:
There are already petitions on this issue
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/search?q=death+penalty
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/search?q=capital+punishment
Please consider signing an existing petition, rather than creating another.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
